node.title: Amazon CEO: No "silver bullet" for curbing worker injuries
node.description: In his first letter to shareholders, Andy Jassy said the retailer "has a ways to go" to improve safety for employees.

node.title: Jackson confirmation furthers GOP's tough-on-crime push before midterms
node.description: A recent CBS News poll found 39% of Americans approve of the president's handling of crime, while 61% disapprove.

node.title: A song about grief: Tami Neilson and Willie Nelson come together for new duet
node.description: Auckland-based singer-songwriter Tami Neilson has hit a new high, releasing a duet with the legendary musician Willie Nelson. Audio

node.title: Potential Tennessee bill threatens felony charges for encampments on public land
node.description: Felony convictions in Tennessee result in the revocation of an individual's right to vote.

node.title: Teacher named students and ridiculed their work on podcast
node.description: A Christchurch high school teacher who discussed sexual acts, drug use and his students on a podcast has been found guilty of misconduct.

node.title: Southee wins top New Zealand Cricket award
node.description: Black Caps bowler takes top gong at New Zealand Cricket Awards.

node.title: Black Sticks booked for trans-Tasman series in NZ
node.description: The first internationals for both Black Sticks teams since last year's Olympic Games have been locked in.

node.title: Mysterious sarcophagus found below Notre Dame to be opened
node.description: Scientists have already peeked into the sarcophagus using an endoscopic camera, revealing part of a skeleton and as-yet unidentified objects.

node.title: Brooklyn subway attack suspect held without bail
node.description: Frank James, who is suspected in the attack that injured at least 23 people, did not enter a plea Thursday.

node.title: Taxes 2022: Here's how to get an extension from the IRS
node.description: As of April 1, some 70 million Americans had yet to file their returns. Here's what to do if you need more time.

node.title: Man convicted in woman's 2006 murder even though body wasn't found
node.description: A cigarette with Derrill Ennis' DNA was found near Lori Ann Slesinski's burned vehicle.

node.title: Peloton hikes subscription fees by 13% in first-ever rate hike
node.description: Bikes and treadmills will cost less, but U.S. consumers will have to pay 13% more for their monthly Peloton subscriptions.

node.title: Jury reaches verdict in case of alleged British ISIS member
node.description: El Shafee Elsheikh is one of three British men accused in brutal ISIS hostage-taking scheme that led to the deaths of four Americans.

node.title: Companies look to 4-day workweek
node.description: California lawmakers are considering a bill to make the standard workweek 32 hours instead of 40 hours for companies with 500 or more employees.

node.title: Abbott defies pressure over new border policy that's gridlocking trucks
node.description: To curb human and drug trafficking Abbott announced that trucks crossing southern border into Texas must undergo extra inspections.

node.title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signs 15-week abortion ban bill
node.description: The measure is one of several abortion recent restrictions signed by Republican governors

node.title: College students are uniting to demand better and more say
node.description: "People deserve to be paid more than $9.30 an hour," one student worker said of her campus job.

node.title: Colombian fugitive wanted for wife's 1994 murder caught in Boston suburb
node.description: William Hernando Usma Acosta fatally shot his wife in June 1994, and tried to kill his daughter when she intervened, authorities say.

node.title: 4 Germans arrested over nationwide blackout and kidnapping plot
node.description: The group, which opposes COVID-19 restrictions, allegedly planned to kidnap public figures, including Health Minister Karl Lauterbach.

node.title: Americans still spending despite soaring inflation
node.description: Retail sales edged up in March, with consumers buoyed by wage gains and steady job growth.

node.title: Hunter Biden case could thrust low-key prosecutor into spotlight
node.description: U.S. Attorney David Weiss, a Trump appointee kept on by President Biden, is described as "a straight shooter."

node.title: Experts warn about potential security risks, scams in metaverse
node.description: Experts believe where there's money to be made, the criminals won't be far behind and money and personal info are at risk.

node.title: U.K. blasted over "racist" plan to send asylum-seekers to Rwanda
node.description: Rwanda welcomed the $157 million deal to resettle people who enter the U.K. illegally, but a rights group accused Boris Johnson's government of "offshoring" its responsibilities.

node.title: Sled dogs owned by Iditarod veteran, reality TV star kill family pet
node.description: "This tragedy was avoidable," wrote the owner of Lucky, an 8-year-old Havanese,

node.title: Africa appears over omicron with COVID cases at lowest level in 2 years
node.description: The WHO warned, however, that with winter approaching for Southern Hemisphere countries, "there is a high risk of another wave of new infections."

node.title: Gamer says headset saved him when stray bullet flew through window
node.description: Jonathan Gonzalez says he was playing video games when the bullet entered his room, hit his headset and ricocheted around before landing on his bed.

node.title: Video shows dolphin attacking trainer during show in Miami
node.description: Video shows the trainer struggling to stay afloat as the dolphin, dragged her underwater and then pushed her forward.

node.title: Ukraine says it has hobbled one of Russia's most important warships
node.description: It's another important victory for Ukraine's out-gunned forces, but it comes amid growing desperation as civilians flee eastern regions ahead of an expected offensive.

node.title: Biden administration unveils steps to boost equity in government
node.description: The efforts are the product of an executive order President Biden signed just after taking office.

node.title: Suspect in Brooklyn subway shooting arrested
node.description: Investigators believe Frank James may have tipped off police to his own whereabouts.
